poem:
### The Mechanic's Dilemma

In England's mist, the iron horses  
Wait; their owners' purses thinner,  
Autumn's breath a colder price.  
Costs rise like leaves in the wind,  
Turning the wrenches of hope  
Into whispered rust. A toll  
On quiet mornings where men  
Dream of simpler journeys  
Before the march of the ledger's pen.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
